info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 3:37PM PDT until August 11 at 6:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Lincoln County in south central Nevada... North Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 645 PM PDT. * At 337 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated scattered thunderstorms producing heavy rain across southeastern Lincoln County including Kane Springs Road. These storms are producing rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour and have seen several rounds of rainfall through the day. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cabin Pines Campground, Kane Springs Road between Caliente and Highway 93, Beaver Dam State Park, Carp and Elgin. Anyone recreating in southeast Lincoln county need to avoid washes or any area slot canyons and these will flood rapidly and pose an immediate danger to life. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
